programme.title: Robot Carnival
programme.desc: Eight fantasy segments by Japanese filmmakers show variations on the theme of robots.

programme.title: Devilman
programme.desc: A powerful demon (Hisato Izaki) tries to prevent an apocalyptic war between his race and mankind.

programme.title: The House of the Lost on the Cape
programme.desc: A strange old woman allows a teenage runaway and a young orphan to stay in an abandoned house that overlooks the sea. However, when a menacing entity threatens their new home, they must band together and face their fears to save it.

programme.title: Ghost Stories
programme.sub-title: Shirotabi: The Corpse That Wanders The Night
programme.desc: There's a girl in Satsuki's class who is a little off; she tends to the rabbits at the school, whom she says are her only friends; but if that's weird, then it gets only stranger when a dead rabbit shows back up at the pen, alive and well.

programme.title: Ghost Stories
programme.sub-title: The Tunnel With No Exit - Anamaneki
programme.desc: Hajime has a close encounter with a spooky cab, which the rest of the gang doesn't believe; even when they see it for themselves, it seems like a perfectly normal cab, that is until the cab driver takes them to a life-draining tunnel.

programme.title: Ghost Stories
programme.sub-title: The Shadows of Horror: The Talking Mary Doll
programme.desc: The gang finds a strange doll in the trash; Satsuki prevents Keiichiro from bringing the doll home, but it shows up regardless; late at night, Satsuki gets a phone call from none other than the doll herself.

programme.title: Ghost Stories
programme.sub-title: A Nurse Who Sentences Death: Mother's Love
programme.desc: A strange nurse haunts Keiichiro, which triggers memories of the past; Satsuki and Keiichiro remember the death of their mother; Momoko meets their mother just before she passes away.

programme.title: Medabots
programme.desc: A tree makes Rokusho dream of his past.

programme.title: Medabots
programme.desc: Rokusho is challenged to a battle by Metabee.

programme.title: Medabots
programme.desc: Medaforce helps Metabee destroy Robo-Emperor.

programme.title: Medabots
programme.desc: After Robattle rankings are announced, Ikki and Medabee become famous.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Tails wants to join a family, so he seeks out a billboard with a picture of a family searching for their missing son.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Sonic rescues Captain Rescue, but soon finds his heroic efforts hampered by Rescue's incompetence; after Sonic rejects his attempts to help, Rescue is tricked by Robotnik into capturing Sonic.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Grounder makes a bet with Scratch that he can catch Sonic first; the robotic chicken orders a build-it-yourself Eagle Copter kit from his favorite TV Show.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Sonic suspects Robotnik when he wakes up and finds his shoes gone, but he can't run without the shoes, so he has to use detective work.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: The robots rip open a door to an alternate dimension,and a blob creature falls into Tails hands.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Mama Robotnik escapes from the asylum to wreak revenge on Sonic; she locks him in her torture chamber.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Robotnik constructs a robot replica to ruin Sonic's reputation.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Robotnik's design for a Super-Genius chip is stolen by Hacker the Mole; Grounder ousts Robotnik and succeeds in capturing Sonic.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Dr. Robotnik invents a Super Stopper-Zapper that he tries to use to petrify Sonic; Tails has to keep Sonic away from Robotnik until he can cure his condition.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Robotnik installs a new obedience microchip in Scratch and Grounder and orders them to drill for a rare mineral in a tropical mountain.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Robotnik is after the Power Gems from the city of Submerbia in the Labyrinth Zone; Princess Bubbles' Merman boyfriend goes to Sonic for help.

programme.title: Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Robotnik creates a machine capable of turning dreams into reality.

programme.title: Future Boy Conan
programme.desc: 20 years after a devastating war, an old man and a young boy named Conan live on Remnant Island; one day, Conan finds a girl named Lana on the shore; when Lana is abducted by soldiers, Conan and his grandfather must spring into action.

programme.title: Future Boy Conan
programme.desc: Conan travels by plane and sea as he tries to rescue Lana from the clutches of Industria soldiers.

programme.title: Future Boy Conan
programme.desc: Conan arrives on a small island and meets Jimsy, a boy who has been living in the wild; as Conan gets to know his new friend, the ship Barracuda offers an opportunity to finally reach Industria.

programme.title: Future Boy Conan
programme.desc: Conan and Jimsy attempt to stowaway aboard the Barracuda, but are caught and punished by the ship's captain Dyce; they get to work as the ship heads for Industria.

programme.title: Future Boy Conan
programme.desc: The Barracuda finally arrives in Industria and Conan and Jimsy are stunned to find it bleak and deserted; Conan races through the complex searching for Lana.

programme.title: Future Boy Conan
programme.desc: Conan and Lana are finally reunited but the villainous Lepka continues to pursue them; shocked by Lepka's brutality, Captain Dyce's allegiances begin to shift.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd
programme.sub-title: Where Are the Peking Man's Bones
programme.desc: Lupin is in Hong Kong for a vacation when he is asked to find a woman in exchange for help escaping from Inspector Zenigata.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd
programme.desc: The Sleeping Lion, a statue made of solid gold, is being transported to a museum by a specially armored airtight car; Lupin steals the armored car together with the statue.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd
programme.desc: Lupin manages to steal crime boss Mulligan's precious jewels, but the jewels are taken by Fujiko; Mulligan, unaware that Fujiko has his jewels, hires a skilled gunman to take them back.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd
programme.sub-title: Lupin Is Available to the Highest Bidder
programme.desc: Lupin is auctioned at the Wanted Club, a place that sells criminals as slaves. Dr Derange wins Lupin and plans to use him as a human guinea pig on his deserted island.

programme.title: Aim for the Ace!
programme.desc: The doubles semifinals have begun; as Hiromi rushes to the court, a lone girl suddenly stands in her way; her opponent, Yumi Kawamura of Ohara High.

programme.title: Aim for the Ace!
programme.desc: With the Kanto Junior Championship finals match in sight, Hiromi's training kicks into high gear, and on the court, shining in the morning sun, Hiromi sees Todo training in silence.

programme.title: Aim for the Ace!
programme.sub-title: No tears for the last match
programme.desc: One day, as Captain Hoshino's send off match nears, Kyoko asks Coach Munakata if she can be paired with Hiromi; then, she gives Hiromi a notebook filled with all of her shortcomings.

programme.title: Aim for the Ace!
programme.desc: The South Kanto Training Camp, which takes the top junior players, is taking place with 17 players, including Hiromi; all of the strongest players that Hiromi's faced so far.

programme.title: Hajime no Ippo
programme.desc: Ippo reads Mari's article; Ippo invites Nekota to his fight; both Sendo and Ippo have their weigh-in; Sendo and Ippo begin their rematch, with Ippo getting a very early knockdown on Sendo.
